how to extract .img files in ubuntu?: sudo mount -o loop /path/to/file.img /mnt/
=> mount: you must specify the filesystem type
What type of floppy image is it?

Floppy images are usually just bit for bit dumps of the floppy contents. Those contents can contain any number of filesystems or partition tables (though you usually don't have a partition table on a floppy).
Can you pastebin the output of "file -k /path/to/file.img" ?

and so how can I configure syslinux to boot an img file?
You don't per-se. You configure it to load a linux kernel.
Rename "file.img" "vmlinuz" and use it as you would any kernel :)
